channel.title: Posts on Cameron Diou Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Cameron Diou Portfolio

item.title: Hylafax
item.description: At iFAX Solutions I work with our customers to install and maintain servers in enterprise environments. Our software has a variety of uses so most servers are unique and provide their own challenges. The stack of software I configure and maintain on these servers can be found below: SR140 - Virtual Fax Modem that uses closed source software. Postfix - Customers can email faxes to the server, receive notifications, and reports to relays or as its own mail server.

item.title: Links
item.description: My links Email: c@merondiou.com Github: https://github.com/camerondiou iFAX Solutions Github https://github.com/camerondiou-iFAXSolutions Credits Build with Hugo: https://gohugo.io Theme: https://github.com/Yukuro/hugo-theme-shell

item.title: Cameron Diou
item.description: If there has been one thing in my life that set in motion so much of who I am today it would be Linux. I started playing around with Linux back in 2006 with Yellow Dog Linux on my PS3. That quickly became an obsession and I started looking into all the distros that were around and eventually I found Ubuntu. This was back when you could get on a list and have someone mail you a physical copy of the OS.

item.title: Whatsthat
item.description: After graduating TCU in 2017 my old roommate had recently launched a startup called WhatsThat! in Amsterdam. The application was a social network where you would post images of something interesting and have your friends try to guess what it is. Since I was a recent graduate my roommate invited me to come see the office and what they were working on. After spending some time with the team at WhatsThat I was invited to join the company.

item.title: Sheepdog Technologies
item.description: While I was at TCU I decided to take a break my Jr year and founded a startup company called “Sheepdog Technologies” with my roommate and some of my friends from Boy Scouts. We worked on an application for Google Glass to reinvent the tour guide experience with this new technology and ibeacons. We ended up working with several museums and even had members from the Smithsonian and Travelocity on our board.
